website_summaries.verdict: While affordable, these balls are just OK; though many consumers brag about how much their dogs enjoy them.
pros: Constructed with real rubber, deep seams, and wool fiber
Pack of 12 features tennis balls that are suitable for practicing and casual play
cons: Not as bouncy as pricier or more popular brands
Reports of flat balls upon delivery, and balls breaking with rough play, are common

customer_reviews.title: Great impulse purchase for my dog
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, this was one of those impulse purchases that seems to happen way too frequently while roaming Amazon. I wanted to see how much my dog would love 12 tennis balls bouncing around the house all at once!!! Balls came unpackaged in a cardboard box, so it was an easy tilt and drop for them to go flying. Purchase was worth the 30 seconds of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Great ball for active dogs!
customer_reviews.text: These are great tennis balls for my dogs who love to play fetch! They are also durable when they end up in the swimming pool! They are fairly puncture proof unlike the ones marketed for dogs. Good bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Simer

customer_reviews.title: Withstand Boston Terrier Chewing
customer_reviews.text: My active and chewing aggressive Boston Terrier pup LOVES the balls! Covering remains fairly well secured around interior ball. I bought a 2nd box after he lovingly destroyed the 1st box over many months! Recommend highly!
customer_reviews.author: Susan at the Beach

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: Dyeable tennis balls. My dog can destroy a toy in an afternoon. These have lasted two weeks. SUCCESS!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie

customer_reviews.title: Seems like the tennis balls meant for pets don't last very ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog Elle. She loves tennis balls (what dog doesn't?). Seems like the tennis balls meant for pets don't last very long. These are meant for tennis, but are holding up well to Elle's chewing.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaPepper

customer_reviews.title: Not sure how they compare for playing tennis but they are a great price for a pet toy
customer_reviews.text: Basic, garden variety tennis balls at a reasonable price. I purchased them for our dog and she enjoys them. Not sure how they compare for playing tennis but they are a great price for a pet toy.
customer_reviews.author: Leese

customer_reviews.title: These work great on a walker
customer_reviews.text: These work great on a walker. Just cut a slit with a box-cutter knife and slip onto the rear legs of the walker. Much more economical than the ready made walker tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: V. O. Ritter

customer_reviews.title: These are pure garbage. I got them as dog toys for my ...
customer_reviews.text: These are pure garbage. I got them as dog toys for my lab puppy, which they were sort of okay for when he was little, but now that he's a 70 lbs dog, he can simply burst these with one bite--not so with Wilson or Penn balls, All that said, if you were buying these to actually play tennis with, forget it. They have large casting seams that would make them bounce funny and have ultra cheap fuzz that starts fraying immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Dickinson

customer_reviews.title: ZERO BOUNCE -- DEAD AS DEAD CAN GET
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the WORST tennis balls in the history of man..... ZERO bounce in this junk. I bought them for the dogs --- and use a tennis ball tosser to put them way in the air so when they hit --- they should bounce like crazy --- NOT THESE!! They just flop on the ground - dead as dead can get. In other words useless.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Weld

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Dogs to play fetch at park
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my dogs to play fetch in park. One of my dogs seems to lose at least 3-5 tennis balls a week playing fetch at park and when I saw the price for the amount of balls I jumped on a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Best ball for the wall and ball machine workout
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a nice ball to practice on the wall during the virus shutdown. These balls are ideal for that and better than the green for balls. Both slow down the ball just enough to allow you time to execute good technique, but these balls are the best by far if you want a workout that allows you to drive through the ball without fear that it will come back too fast. I would expect these to be perfect for the ball machine as well because they give a nice bounce at just a slightly slower speed than a regular ball.
customer_reviews.author: topseed

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: These were a great price and I love the easy access bag. Very durable too. They survived the jaws of my GSD Ginger who can crush anything.
customer_reviews.author: R F Barchiesi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a pit puppy
customer_reviews.text: I love these tennis balls! Way higher quality than the ones available at most pet stores. They have held up well to my pitbull mix who can shred a Petco tennis ball in less than three minutes. She doesn't like the texture of the Kong tennis balls very much but these ones she loves. These balls are really well made and have a lot of bounce to them. The inner portion of the ball is pretty sturdy and resists puncture more than others I have tried. Good value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: OoberDogLover

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my needs but I don't play tennis.
customer_reviews.text: For fun we tested to see if we got any "dead" balls. We are not tennis players but it seemed like 3 where towards their end of life. We put tennis balls in our drier to fluff our clothes, dry them faster and they eliminate the need for dryer sheets. Some are stored for later use and the rest are used to toss around when goofing off with our family and pets.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessita

customer_reviews.title: Great for OCD Dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my obsessive compulsive Border Collie who lives to chase balls. We can't even call them balls, or spell ball because she knows what that means so these are "Yellow Turkeys". I don't know how well they will work for tennis but they are a great for throwing 100,000 times in a row to be retrieved by an insane dog. She usually rips all of the fuzz off of yellow turkeys but not these, they don't de-fuzz as easily as other Yellow Turkeys. Eventually, she's going to figure out what yellow Turkey means and we'll have to call them something else. Regardless of what we call them, I'll be buying more!
customer_reviews.author: KDC

customer_reviews.title: I didnt buy these for the court, but to ...
customer_reviews.text: I didnt buy these for the court, but to keep the sofa cover on the leather sofa, buy pushing them into the grooves.....works great
customer_reviews.author: Casey66421

customer_reviews.title: Quickly eaten
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I guess these are fine. I got these for my 3 dogs. The bounce high, at first, but then kind of fizzle out right away. They are also very easily squashed by dog mouths. More so than other tennis balls I've gotten. Maybe they are amazing for tennis. Not great for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Becki

customer_reviews.title: Round, bright and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Our Boston Terrier is OBSESSED with tennis balls! She can chase them for hours. Unfortunately she also tears them up. This bundle of tennis balls is just what we needed to keep her running! They appear as sturdy as any tennis ball can be, have a bright easy to see color. Loved that we could buy them in a large amount.
customer_reviews.author: sking

customer_reviews.title: Cheap-ish balls good enough for dog toy.
customer_reviews.text: Great balls for tossing for my dig to catch and fetch. These are in no way suitable for playing tennis. They have no real bounce by comparison. They’ll bounce slightly but they aren’t pressurized. They’re priced ok enough such that I don’t fret when I accidentally throw one over the fence into no-man’s land.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Quinley

customer_reviews.title: Great for practice
customer_reviews.text: I play tennis ball every week because I have promised my girlfriend i will lose 20 lb at the end of May, 2018. I have used these for over a month now and you guessed it, still using the first one. Really impressed by the quality, hope I can make it before May.
customer_reviews.author: jwe

customer_reviews.title: Not for tennis
customer_reviews.text: These are not good for playing tennis. They're dead or die very quickly. Maybe I got a bad batch, but mine were very bad. I'm sure they're great for things like dogs and non tennis things.
customer_reviews.author: Willis

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Tennis
customer_reviews.text: These might be good for a dog but not for practice or training, certainly not advanced. They have very little bounce. Might be good for a beginner but there are different types of tennis ball for those groups.
customer_reviews.author: Hopefullee

customer_reviews.title: A great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I’ve purchased these tennis balls. I bought them for my dog. I was worried about quality because the price was unbeatable but they are very sturdy, they have good bounce to them and my dog doesn’t tear these up. We always lose tennis balls at either the beach, park or they just go over our fence lol. Will continue to buy these. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Illich

customer_reviews.title: Worst tennis ball ever for dogs!
customer_reviews.text: If you want these as fetch balls for dogs, don't bother! These are the absolute worst tennis balls we've ever had for our dogs. One bite for the dog to pick the ball up, and the weak interior collapses! They last one day each where regular tennis balls last a month or more.
customer_reviews.author: vizlagal

customer_reviews.title: They have a very bad odor
customer_reviews.text: Got these to fluff pillows in the dryer. They smelled horrible straight out of the box, like someone had pooped on them. I dampened them and sprayed them with an odor killer and they were fine. May not use this brand next time I order tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: TwinMum

customer_reviews.title: 12 tennis balls and a Golden Retriever 😁
customer_reviews.text: Great for dogs. My golden was in heaven when we opened the box. Very durable. As with any pet toy.... Adult supervision may be needed. Could recommend.
customer_reviews.author: UpState NYer

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love chasing these around the house. Last a little longer than regular tennis balls.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: A dogs paradise
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my Golden Retriever. It was like Christmas day opening the box. They have held up and didn't break like a lot of tennis balls/dog toys do when my golden chomps down on them. Think they would be great for tennis as well based on the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Flat upon arrival- don't purchase for tennis
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these balls recently and found all of them to be flat. Do NOT purchase for actual tennis. I'm giving them to my neighbors dog because they are so useless.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them too
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good for my use. I throw them for my Black lab. He loves them too. He always retrieves them as required. However I have hound that also loves them. He manages to skin the fuzz off every one of them. He also pops them. Good balls though. They both love them.
customer_reviews.author: boog

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by Dog.
customer_reviews.text: Given to a super-chewer. He pops tennis balls very quickly because of his intensity. He loved these, though. I would buy them again in a heartbeat. If your dog likes tennis balls, they'd probably be cool with these.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Not favorable
customer_reviews.text: Reviews failed me. These balls didn’t last 2 minutes for ball chasing for a dog. Maybe these balls would be ok for youth tennis, but once you throw them on the ground, the seal on the inside cracks. Very poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Dog Lovers: Not a tennis ball for dogs
customer_reviews.text: I thought this ball may be stronger for my dogs then the regular tennis balls I buy for them. These balls popped within 2-3 minutes of them chewing on them and shredded shortly afterwards. The regular tennis balls last months before they are popped. I realize these are for tennis, but I have had better balls that last longer for my huskies. Disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Pineapplegirl

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for larger dogs
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 65lb black lab to play with. Normally can get a few weeks out of a normal tennis ball before they pop. These only lasted a day or two before they split in half. They don't bounce as much and seem harder than normal.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: These balls are JUNK! AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on these based on the reviews and was incredibly disappointed with their quality. I'm a novice tennis player, so it's not like I have high standards. I figured, how different can tennis balls be? Now I know. They bounce totally unpredictably (or sometimes barely at all) in completely random directions, and shed like crazy. It's basically impossible to play a game or rally with them. One even busted after just a little bit of use. These are not worth the savings.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: They fall apart....
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my dog to retrieve. The first ball didn’t last but two or three days before it split. Now it’s only held together by the material. Thought maybe it was just a bad one so I tried another and another....but sadly they are all like that. My dog is not even a chewier. He retrieves it and comes back to drop it. We have some better ones that we’ve had for 3 years. My opinion is, these are poorly made and I wouldn’t buy they again. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Davis

customer_reviews.title: Break easily, even when just throwing
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our dog as she loves to play ball. They are junk, the first ball we threw she chased and when she brought it back it was cracked. I thought maybe it was a fluke, but guess what, each time we threw a ball it came back broken.
customer_reviews.author: Linnea

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 12 with defects
customer_reviews.text: These balls looked like they would be a good value for the money but two out of the 10 had defects. One had a gash underneath the felt so it had no pressure inside and another had a significant wrinkle in the felt.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I started hitting with them I realized there were holes in some of the balls out of the package. I guess these are good dog balls but not if you actually play tennis!
customer_reviews.author: bh

customer_reviews.title: Come unglued after just a little use
customer_reviews.text: Got these to shoot in k9 jan on dog tennis ball shooter and about half of the 12 I got come unglued where balls are put together only after a very little use. Winn not but these again because of this!
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN

customer_reviews.title: Great price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pack for my dogs who go through balls like there is no tomorrow. So far no complaints. They do what they are supposed to do and my dogs have yet to chew through one of them so that is a plus. The balls came in a box.
customer_reviews.author: Qness

customer_reviews.title: Okay but not very durable
customer_reviews.text: I was happy to find these at a reasonable price, as my dog loves to fetch the tennis ball. I have not been very impressed with the quality, however. After just a couple of weeks, they split in half and are not longer usable. Tennis balls made by name brand companies such as Penn last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: PJO

customer_reviews.title: Good training balls.
customer_reviews.text: Seems low in elasticity, so speed is slower, we played on board, it allows some extra time for us to catch the ball, as beginner tennis players, it is perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Zeng

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fetch
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog. She is obsessed with playing fetch with tennis balls. I think it's a good product, but not for a tennis player. Some of the balls were uneven with bubbles. I give four stars since a couple of them were defective, and a little expensive. I expected more quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce V

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfy
customer_reviews.text: Everyday I go to play tennis 🎾 and the ball which we order and got it is not good and almost most of the ball are damaged from inside and it’s doesn’t have that much gravity to bounce so pls make sure when someone orders give them a good quality
customer_reviews.author: Asif syed

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these with the intent to give some to my son to play tennis with and some for the dog. Tennis was never played, however the dog is totally obsessed. They seem to work well for the dog, tennis might be ok for a very casual player.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Our GSD's love these. Good quality! Can't say they're good for destructive chewers but for our pups they work great. Would definitely order again.
customer_reviews.author: Tesca

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE! Thin and not good at all. Do not buy these cheap balls form China.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: they were duds.  flat/dead.
customer_reviews.text: one of the only negative amazon reviews I've written. When you get new tennis balls they Cannot be dead / without bounce. I'll use them for my dog now
customer_reviews.author: mark hazen

customer_reviews.title: They shorted me
customer_reviews.text: Product as described. Arrived in 2 days with prime. My only thing with it is they shorted me in one box. Not the biggest deal but if I pay for something I'd like to get what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: lucygirl1186

customer_reviews.title: I’m reviewing a dog toy, right!?!
customer_reviews.text: My dog tore them apart still- I won’t hold it against the product because even the sturdiest toys are goners but I loved being able to buy multiple tennis balls for this price and they last longer than the pet store toys but less than other name brand tennis balls—- in regards to dogs. I have no clue for actual play
customer_reviews.author: Alison Hess

customer_reviews.title: For my dogs
customer_reviews.text: Got them to play fetch with my Mastiff. AS of today he hasn't split them but hasn't really chewed on them like other toys.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My Dog
customer_reviews.text: Got tired of my dog destroying expensive tennis balls so I opted for this less costly option. She's happy and so am I.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie K

customer_reviews.title: Fun Gift For Our Dog!
customer_reviews.text: Our lab/great dane mix LOVED his pkg. He is working his way through each ball. Hours of entertainment. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MOMOf3NJ

customer_reviews.title: They last about a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tennis balls to play w my dogs. They fell apart in a week. Sent them back. Looking for a name brand now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Burtman

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal with tennis balls. My dog goes through tennis balls like candy with as often as he loses them. These tennis balls are cheap enough that I don't mind when they get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Walker Glides
customer_reviews.text: Using these economical tennis balls as walker glides. Seem to perform better than the faux tennis ball glides.
customer_reviews.author: Arnie W.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: Throughout the years I have bought my dogs balls from amazon. They are the favorite toy for them. When I see they are a lower price I stock up. You can never have to many balls.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Botto

customer_reviews.title: Product as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Used them to dry my down sleeping bag. Didn’t need so many but I’ll give them to cute dogs when I see them.
customer_reviews.author: 0utd00r Wand3r3r

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves em!
customer_reviews.text: I buy bulk tennis balls when the supply dwindles for my XL dog. She usually tears right through them. This time chose this brand and she hasn't destroyed one yet! Coincidence? I don't know! Nice small packaging. Arrived quickly. I will buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: durable. good quality
customer_reviews.text: bought these for my dog. she loved toys. unfortunately she still prefers to attack every rock in our yard. great value and tennis balls though. very durable
customer_reviews.author: salma

customer_reviews.title: Great for playing with my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I honestly cannot comment on how these are for tennis, but they are great for playing fetch with my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Garbo916

customer_reviews.title: Good for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Good for dogs. I don't play tennis, but the seam splits and it doesn't have the correct pressure.
customer_reviews.author: hahaisdustin

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Just weak practice balls, no pressure whatsoever ever. Cheap but I guess you get whatcha pay for. They are good for practice or trying to build power in your swing.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great balls for the price . . .
customer_reviews.text: I've got balls forever and they are quiet as a whisper on the back walker supports. The patient smiled for days as he sped through the carpeted halls.
customer_reviews.author: G-Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the $$$$$
customer_reviews.text: First two balls out of the box and my Lab destroyed them in under 10 minutes playing fetch. Very little bounce.
customer_reviews.author: VWALL

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids learning the play tennis
customer_reviews.text: Brought them for a tennis learning class for my 9 year old.Well made and quality is not on par with a known brand but Served my purpose of using them for practice. No complaints for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: HarryG

customer_reviews.title: Skip this and get a good quality set in pressurized cannisters
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with these. Balls have depressurized to don't have the right bounce.
customer_reviews.author: Drac14

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: First of all they don't smell bad. Good price for what we are using them for. We plan to glue them to a board to make them look like a pile of cannonballs after they are spray painted.
customer_reviews.author: EMV

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Medium Chuckit
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves playing with his Chuckit and these balls fit perfectly in the Medium. Long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: momof5boys

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Great for dogs. Less so for people, unless you enjoy playing tennis with flat balls.
customer_reviews.author: readsalotofbooks

customer_reviews.title: Just right for first time player.
customer_reviews.text: Tennis balls for beginner. Not too expensive for the first time player.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Jack Russell mix loves these
customer_reviews.text: Jack Russell mix needs to be kept active, so tennis balls are a must have. These were a great value
customer_reviews.author: E. Durham

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my lab!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a retriever you need to find a good deal on tennis balls. The balls you buy at the pet store just come apart in the middle quickly. Real tennis balls last much longer. Glad to find a reasonable source!!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Unclebach

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment for my pup...
customer_reviews.text: Well these tennis balls are a godsend for my little bundle of energy... These definitely wear her out... She is addicted to them already and I love watching her run like the wind to catch and fetch them... She leaps like crazy chasing these tennis balls and gets so excited when she finally gets a hold of it... It's just as much fun for me as it is for her... Perfect size for a Shih Tzu dog... Will be buying more of these in the future for sure...
customer_reviews.author: kuki

customer_reviews.title: NOT durable
customer_reviews.text: These balls are not durable at all. One ball came ruptured in the package and after playing 3 or so times we had ruptured another 2 or 3. These are cheap for a reason, not worth the lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Glauser

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: They came apart very quickly. Separation of the two halves. Ordered Penn again. what a difference. In this case: you get what you pay for. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Frieder Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: Happy puppy
customer_reviews.text: The dog had a great birthday with these. Most are still intact
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use for laundry balls, but have used a couple to throw for the dog as well. They're made well and work for both purposes!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah D.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I bought these for my dog, he loves to play fetch and bright colors are easier to find for me as I am visually impaired. They are great quality as my pup hasn't chewed through them in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ralston

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: They worked fantastic as training tennis balls, just what I've been looking for. They have the right amount of weight and firm enough to take a lot of hit. I don't need to worry about changing the balls after every session because I have 12 of em. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: james kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: As described. Used for kids and not for actual tennis
customer_reviews.author: Stan K.

customer_reviews.title: My Border Collie was very happy to get this for Christmas!
customer_reviews.text: My Border Collie was very happy to get this for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Elle01

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd approved !!:)
customer_reviews.text: My doggo loves this tennis balls I keep buying them. anything to see my boy happy :) they are so bouncy!!! Best purchase you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeymmy

customer_reviews.title: Not good for using with dogs
customer_reviews.text: These may be great for tennis but are not sturdy enough for playing catch with my lab. She crushes them almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: dmg

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product 👍
customer_reviews.text: These Tennis balls are very strong and durable. I am using them on my walker for a smooth ride on the bottom of the legs. Have not worn out after a month or 2 .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon CustomerLindapoole88

customer_reviews.title: Got these for my Dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a huge tennis ball obsession and was so happy when we poured out the box and they all bounced everywhere. I dont play tennis but I do have a tennis racket to throw the ball for my dog, from what I can tell its probably not the highest quality for a tennis player.
customer_reviews.author: lilly

customer_reviews.title: There as what u see
customer_reviews.text: there tennis balls there are being use for laundry not to play tennis
customer_reviews.author: ANGELOUS KAL EL

customer_reviews.title: Ok for tennis not strong enough for dogs
customer_reviews.text: We used these as play toys for our German Shepherd. They could not stand up to her powerful jaws. Every ball separated in half.
customer_reviews.author: cindy

customer_reviews.title: Not dog toy.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these to use for playing ball with dogs. They lasted about 5 minutes. I had to throw them all away.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Anne Moore

customer_reviews.title: my dog loves them and u guys r great i mean it
customer_reviews.text: you guys are so aesome, like in allsorts of catagories!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsi Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Got for dog; too easy to destroy
customer_reviews.text: I know tennis balls aren't great for dogs. And yes my dog can destroy all tennis balls.... But these are even weaker than normal ones! I Will not be purchasing again. I will spend double on normal tennis balls next time.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Nott much bounce to the ounce.
customer_reviews.text: Nott much bounce to the ounce. May be good as practice balls, but are being used on a walker to protect floors. Work well in that use.
customer_reviews.author: quadsforever

customer_reviews.title: Not good for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Well maybe I’m not using them right seeing I bought them for my dog but they don’t even last one park outing without falling into two pieces went through 6in 6 days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bright. Thick and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a walker, these are great size and nice& thick. So I assume they’ll be durable. Bright yellow!
customer_reviews.author: Lewie D

customer_reviews.title: Shipping damage, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with two damaged balls. First time using a ball and it was destroyed after 20 minutes of play. Very poor quality. May be good for your dog but not actual tennis.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffbest

customer_reviews.title: Great for dogs fetch!
customer_reviews.text: I buy these balls for my golden retriever. They are durable and last lots of fetches!
customer_reviews.author: stacy moseley

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a bad production batch?? Refund please!!
customer_reviews.text: I’d hope for a good quality like that of Wilson or Dunlop brands. Literally within minutes of opening the package my dogs broke open 3 balls. Crazy how bad the quality. If they broke open brand names it took weeks of chewing. Surprised as this brand was listed in the pet section.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy  Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Dog Toy
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. My Dog loves them but destroys them pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Simon L.

customer_reviews.title: dog toy
customer_reviews.text: As others have said this set of balls are DOG TOUGH and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: ramrod3

product_meta.title: KEVENZ 12-Pack Standard Pressure Training Tennis Balls, Highly Elasticity, More Durable, Good for Beginner Training Ball
feature_bullets: Package including: 12 pack standard pressure training tennis, color is green
LASTING DURABILITY: Durable felt ensures the all courts tennis balls will play like new for as long as possible.
Thickened tennis liner for better sealing and long-lasting airtightness
Standard pressure training tennis，the Feeling is comfortable, the landing point is easy to control, the speed is slow in order to train beginners
Meet the requirements of various venues, ideal for tennis ball machines, tennis practice, or even playing with your pets
